title: Probability
text: To calculate the probability, we divide the number of cards with the desired outcome by the total number of possible outcomes.
speech: To calculate the probability, we divide the number of cards with the desired outcome by the total number of possible outcomes.
pacedSpeech: To calculate the probability, we divide the number of cards with the desired outcome by the total number of possible outcomes.

title: Possible Outcomes
text: How many total cards are there in the deck? This represents the number of possible outcomes for a single turn.
speech: How many total cards are there in the deck? This represents the number of possible outcomes for a single turn.
pacedSpeech: How many total cards are there in the deck? This represents the number of possible outcomes for a single turn.

title: Desired Outcome
text: How many cards are either a diamond or a spade? This is the number of cards with the desired outcome.
speech: How many cards are either a diamond or a spade? This is the number of cards with the desired outcome.
pacedSpeech: How many cards are either a diamond or a spade? This is the number of cards with the desired outcome.
